article: -14Every artist knows in his heart that he is saying something to _ . Not only _ want to say it well, but he wants to be something which _ been said before. He hopes the public will listen and understand he wants to teach them and he wants them to _ from him.What visual artists like painters want to teach is easy to make _ but difficult to explain, because painters translate their experiences into _ and colors, not words. They seem to feel a _ selection of shapes and colors is exceptionally interesting for them and _ showing to us. Without their work we should never have _ these particular shapes and colors, _ have felt the delight which they brought to the artist. Most artists take their shapes and colors from the world of _ and from human bodies in motion and repose. Their choices _ that these aspects of the world are worth looking _ , that they contain beautiful _ . Contemporary artists might say that they merely _ subjects that provide an interesting pattern, that there is _ more in it. Yet even they do not choose entirely with reference _ that character of their subjects.If one painter chooses to paint an injured leg or a lake in moonlight, each of them is directing our attention _ a certain aspect of the world. Each painter is telling us something, showing us something all of which means _ , consciously or unconsciously, he is _ to reach us.
